Mestia is the regional capital.

The city has recently completed major construction works to make it more tourist-friendly, including a new "highway" (i.e., a mountain road with many curves but in decent state), renovated center area, and a new airport (3.6km from the actual city). This has made traveling to Mestia much easier, but the main street has lost part of its former character. This said, going in the streets just behind the main street immediately brings you to very rural areas with cows, pigs and chicken everywhere, including cows going to the main street.
A new airport in Mestia - Queen Tamar Airport - has recently opened, and flights between Mestia and

are now available 5 times a week for 75 lari each way. Reserve tickets at least a week in advance.

In the summertime a plane flown by the Georgian military will give you a ride between

and Mestia.  The plane only operates on "perfect" days.  This is a very fun experience!  The cost is free to the locals, or ~$15 USD for foreigners.  It will take off from a grassy field in Mestia, and land in Kutaisi in less than an hour! This will reduce travel time to the capital by about 6-8 hours!  The plane flies on Saturdays and leaves Kutaisi at 9. The pilot's name is Leri - 877-199-689 (Info from 2010).

to Mestia has been opened and the trip has become relatively safe and comfortable by public or private transport. The view on the way is amazing. The usual driving time is about 4 hours, although it can be longer in winter following snow falls, or when the road is covered with ice. Whatever the season, it is not advised to drive yourself unless you are used to such mountain roads. Drive with high attention if you are not an experienced driver.

directions=Turn off the Zugdidi-Mestia highway at Becho, then follow the main road in Becho for 2.5 km; the guesthouse is on the left.

content=Irine Japaridze operates a friendly, welcoming guest house in Becho, open year-round, which is located near a roaring river, in a beautiful yard with a garden and fruit trees. There are great views of Ushba, one of the tallest mountains in the Caucasus, and you can walk to a nearby spring which has naturally carbonated water. The food is outstanding, cooked in the flavorful Svan style, and much of it comes fresh from the garden. Becho is a peaceful and quiet village even during the peak of the tourist season. The rooms are comfortable and there is hot water. Day trips to Mestia, Ushguli, and other areas in Svaneti are easy, and Irine can arrange transportation. Bring warm clothes: the bathroom is in another building, and nights in Svaneti can be chilly.
directions=Village Becho, owners pick-up from the main road

content=Great location under Mt. Ushba, with gardens and meadows around, home-made natural traditional food. Horse-riding tours, trekking to waterfalls and Ushba glacier, and mountain river fishing are available. Families, backpackers and climbers are all welcome.

Not much Wi-Fi access, but several cafés, restaurants and guesthouses offer free and decent Wi-Fi.
